channel.title: skating on Teddy's Picnic
channel.description: Recent content in skating on Teddy's Picnic

item.title: Who does the best triple axel?
item.description: To recap, the first post in this series set out the overall project: to predict grade-of-execution scores in international singles figure skating competions, using data from the website skatingscores.

item.title: Data Fetching
item.description: After formulating an idea (we’re going to try and predict technical scores of international figure skating elements) the next step is to fetch the data.

item.title: The Big Picture
item.description: A nice overview of the current scoring rules for singles figure skating can be found here. The gist is that each skater makes two performances: a “short programme” lasting a bit under 3 minutes amd a “free skate” lasting just over 4 minutes.
